required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: eHealth Evidence-based Intervention (EBI) for Latino Youth in Primary Care
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Effectiveness of an eHealth EBI for Latino Youth in Primary Care

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the relative effectiveness of a Hispanic-specific eHealth intervention, "e-Health Familias Unidas," in preventing and reducing drug use, sexual risk behaviors, and STIs among Hispanic youth in primary care. Families will be recruited through four pediatric primary care settings. Pediatric staff and research team members, including nurse assistants and mental health professionals, will implement eHealth Familias Unidas.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Baseline to 6 months, baseline to 12 months, baseline to 24 months, baseline to 36 months
primary_outcome.description: Change in drug use will be reported as the number of days of reported drug use for the previous 90 days with questions from Monitoring the Future

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Baseline to 6 months, baseline to 12 months, baseline to 24 months, baseline to 36 months
primary_outcome.description: Change in unprotected sexual behavior will be reported as endorsement of having had sex without a condom during the previous 90 days using the Sexual Behavior Instrument

primary_outcome.measure: Change in incidence of sexually transmitted infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Baseline to 6 months, baseline to 12 months, baseline to 24 months, baseline to 36 months
primary_outcome.description: Sexually transmitted infection incidence (i.e., gonorrhea and chlamydia) will be analyzed via a Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) from urine specimens

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in family functioning as assessed by the Parenting Practices Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Baseline to 6 months, baseline to 12 months, baseline to 24 months, baseline to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in family functioning will be reported using the Parenting Practices Questionnaire . Response range varies based on questions, but most response items range from 0 to 4 with higher values indicating better parenting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in family functioning as assessed by the Parent Relationship with Peer Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Baseline to 6 months, baseline to 12 months, baseline to 24 months, baseline to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in family functioning will be reported using the Parent Relationship with Peer Group. The Parent Relationship with Peer Group is a six item measure with response items ranging from 0 to 24. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in family functioning as assessed by the Parent-Adolescent Communication Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Baseline to 6 months, baseline to 12 months, baseline to 24 months, baseline to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in family functioning will be reported using the Parent-Adolescent Communication Scale. The Parent-Adolescent Communication Scale is a twenty-item questionnaire with a total score ranging from 20 to 100 with higher scores indicating better communication.

arm_group.description: eHealth Familias Unidas consists of 12 sessions: eight (12 - 15 minute) "mock" parent sessions in Spanish and four (30 - 45 minute) online family sessions delivered in either Spanish and/or English.
Participants in this condition will not receive an intervention.

intervention.description: The experimental condition will consist of "eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care." eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care is an adaptation of the face-to-face version of Familias Unidas. As with face-to-face Familias Unidas, eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care aims to prevent drug use, sexual risk behaviors, and STIs by improving family functioning. Similar to face-to-face Familias Unidas, eHealth Familias Unidas is a multi-level intervention that targets risk and protective factors at the multiple systems affecting the youth and youths' family.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female and male adolescents of Hispanic immigrant origin, defined by at least one parent born in a Spanish speaking country of the Americas. Parent must understand Spanish given that parent sessions are delivered in Spanish.
- Adolescent between the ages of 12 - 17 years
- Adolescent living with an adult primary caregiver who is willing to participate
- Families must have broadband internet access on a device, including (but not limited to) a smart phone, iPad, tablet, a home computer or a computer at another location (e.g., school, library, etc.)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Families reporting plans to move out of the South Florida area during the study period
- Families reporting that adolescent has been diagnosed with a developmental delay

facility.name: Ambulatory Care Center West Pediatrics at Jackson Memorial Hospital
UM UHealth Pediatrics at the Professional Arts Center
University of Miami UHealth Pediatrics at Kendall

clinical_study.keyword: eHealth preventive intervention in primary care

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
